snippet: Concerned about Idaho’s high skin cancer rate, state lawmakers are considering legislation that would restrict tanning salon use among minors.
abstract: Idaho lawmakers, concerned about state having one of the highest rates of melanoma deaths in the country, are considering legislation to restrict tanning salon use among minors; statistics show that people who start using tanning beds before age 30 are 75 percent more likely to develop melanoma.
lead_paragraph: Concerned about Idaho’s high skin cancer rate, state lawmakers are considering legislation that would restrict tanning salon use among minors.

headline.seo: Melanoma Leads Idaho to Consider Limit on Tanning Salons
headline.main: Big Sky, Bright Sun and Melanoma
headline.print_headline: Big Sky, Bright Sun, and Melanoma
